alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knox, west central Leslie and southeastern Clay Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boho, or near Manchester, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Goose Rock around 235 PM EDT. Botto around 240 PM EDT. Plank and Marcum around 245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lipps, Ogle, Creekville, Ice Cliff, Brightshade, Ashers Fork, Spring Creek, Skidmore, Queendale, Roark, Gardner, Salt Gum and Erose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
